intro: Guatteria cardoniana, commonly known as the Cactus Apple or Cactaceae fruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure with thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a berry that turns red when mature and is edible, though often used in traditional medicine. Guatteria cardoniana is adapted to arid environments and can thrive in rocky soils.
